channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title:
Pope Francis has condemned the war in Ukraine, calling for an end to the “unacceptable armed aggression” and the “barbarism of the killing of children.”
But he has carefully avoided naming President Vladimir Putin, or even Russia itself, as the aggressor. https://t.co/Nio7YmgXxm

Russia prevented its first default on foreign debt since the 1917 Bolshevik Revolution by making a $117 million payment on interest due on two U.S. dollar-denominated bonds, its finance ministry said Thursday. https://t.co/WdqRIkpLWi
News Analysis: By labeling Vladimir Putin a "war criminal," President Biden personalized the conflict and showcased an effort to isolate the Russian leader. https://t.co/1I4fyjdCPm

A Polish animal shelter on the border of Ukraine is saving animals affected by the war. "It's in my heart," one veterinarian said.
Follow live updates from Ukraine. https://t.co/hUDmt3lXax https://t.co/IX4I9n0xSL

Breaking News: A 13-year-old boy was behind the wheel of a pickup truck that struck a van in Texas on Tuesday night in a collision that killed nine people, including a college golf coach and six of his players, officials said. https://t.co/kRjyGeAxJQ

Russia’s language around its invasion of Ukraine has been dominated by the word “Nazi,” as Vladimir Putin tries to use stereotypes, distorted reality and his country’s lingering World War II trauma to justify the attack. https://t.co/hKY2j1FXj7

The U.S. would punish China if President Xi Jinping chose to give military aid to Russia for the war in Ukraine, Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on Thursday.
Biden plans to talk on Friday with Xi, who has a close partnership with Vladimir Putin. https://t.co/0QMk5heYaB
Voter fraud is exceedingly rare — and often accidental. Still, Republicans across the U.S. are making a show of cracking down on voter crime this election year. https://t.co/EWuq0npvoR
Breaking News: No. 2-seeded Kentucky lost in overtime to St. Peter's, a No. 15 seed, marking the most surprising upset in the NCAA Men's tournament so far. https://t.co/XR8UnwWMjB

Lia Thomas won an NCAA championship in the 500-yard freestyle on Thursday. With her victory, Thomas, who competes for the University of Pennsylvania, became the first openly transgender woman to win an NCAA swimming title. https://t.co/eRtOM2m1UW

Thirty-five manufacturers around the world have signed agreements to produce generic versions of Pfizer’s Covid pills and sell them inexpensively in 95 lower-income countries that together are home to more than half the world’s people. https://t.co/6gWdSGP1Ab

North Carolina officials said they plan to investigate whether Mark Meadows, Donald Trump’s chief of staff, broke the law when he registered to vote, and voted, from a remote mobile home where he did not live. https://t.co/WlDByEImfs

Breaking News: Moderna asked the FDA to authorize a second booster of its coronavirus vaccine for all adults. The request is significantly broader than Pfizer’s, which was for adults 65 and older. https://t.co/mrpciZX3eF

"This came from Arnold’s heart, not the government."
In a video posted to social media on Thursday, Arnold Schwarzenegger addressed Russians and Russian soldiers, saying, "your lives, your limbs, your futures are being sacrificed for a senseless war." https://t.co/AKDgzrUFCY https://t.co/5PWuyO1kiU

A 15-year-old Louisiana high school student who was captured on video appearing to throw cotton balls at a Black student and whip him several times with a belt was arrested on Tuesday on a hate crime charge, the authorities said. https://t.co/LFJi3jJUzM

A surgical team from Doctors Without Borders arrived in Kyiv this week to train city hospital employees in trauma and mass casualty care. Hospitals, fearing that the worst of Russia's assault has yet to come, are bracing for a potential influx of patients. https://t.co/594ZMhI7LY
After two years of political divisions and a pandemic, many Americans say they're coming together for a common cause: supporting Ukraine. https://t.co/0JtoVRbDps

A 68-year-old American man was killed in a Russian assault on Chernihiv, a city northwest of Kyiv, local authorities in the city said. He and his partner, who is Ukrainian, had traveled to the city so she could be treated for multiple sclerosis. https://t.co/NkUyXAXobN

“Servant of the People,” the 2015 satire that Volodymyr Zelensky starred in before becoming president of Ukraine, has returned to Netflix, the streaming platform said. In the series, Zelensky plays a teacher who becomes president because of a viral video. https://t.co/ws407SZ727

In a series of text messages, a white supervisor and other police officers in Montgomery County, Maryland, talked about a “race war,” and expressed hope that Black Lives Matter protesters would be killed, according to a lawsuit filed by a Black colleague. https://t.co/Ug6PmNv8th

In polls and interviews, Americans across the political spectrum said the U.S. had a duty to respond to President Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine — even if that means feeling, at least in the short term, the pinch of high gas prices and inflation. https://t.co/6bP5cnL6uf

The official Twitter account for the president of Russia follows 22 others — and one of them is Arnold Schwarzenegger, who in a video posted on Thursday debunked Russian disinformation about the war on Ukraine and urged Putin to end the conflict. https://t.co/O1kTCsoenr

The crisis in Ukraine is upending policy and political thinking among both Democratic and Republican lawmakers.
“It’s bringing Congress together in a way, frankly, I haven’t seen in my 12 years,” Senator Chris Coons of Delaware said. https://t.co/1eyr2MKoAR

Hunter Biden has paid off a significant tax liability, but a broad investigation into his business dealings that started as a tax inquiry has remained active. A grand jury is still seeking information about payments from around the world. https://t.co/h5Ue8GEXK3

The fate of hundreds of people in Mariupol, Ukraine, remains unclear after a Russian attack destroyed the theater where they were sheltering.
Follow our updates as the war enters its fourth week. https://t.co/FZ3NEH8bQC

At least 726 civilians have died in fighting since Russia invaded Ukraine, the United Nations said. At least 1,174 civilians had been injured, but UN officials have said the true toll is likely higher.
Live updates: https://t.co/ODtU1JFkXd https://t.co/x3ZEn8KO9O

Oxxxymiron, one of Russia’s most popular rappers, held a benefit concert for Ukrainian refugees in Istanbul. Russians at the show denounced the war but said they felt helpless to stop it.
“I hate feeling so powerless,” the rapper said. https://t.co/QJeQnWGTYq

President Biden said on Wednesday that he believed President Vladimir Putin of Russia was a “war criminal.” Biden was responding to a reporter’s question as he was leaving an event at the White House. https://t.co/NQeMxeXftx https://t.co/vz7IwT5XnR
In Cambodia, few want to remember the Khmer Rouge horrors. https://t.co/ytzVWPs8Jr https://t.co/n2mLXuNnA4

A powerful magnitude-7.4 earthquake off the coast of Japan late on Wednesday night lasted more than two minutes. The quake affected the Fukushima region, where a tsunami a decade ago set off one of the worst nuclear plant disasters in history. https://t.co/5LgExTicci https://t.co/W1WrhZn7ce

The Biden administration will provide Ukraine with additional high-tech defensive weapons that are easily portable and require little training to use against Russian tanks, armored vehicles and aircraft, according to U.S. and European officials. https://t.co/Gr1eYLcvFr

Hours after he implored the U.S. Congress to send arms, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine called for more and tougher economic sanctions against Russia. “The world must finally officially recognize that Russia has become a terrorist state,” he said. https://t.co/L42DUW34k6
It’s pretty common to find some gray or white fuzz on one or two berries in a package. But are the rest safe to eat? Here’s what the experts say. https://t.co/OWG1BIB6Cf https://t.co/XWdEC2lxpt

More than 7,000 Russian troops have died since Russia's invasion of Ukraine began, according to American intelligence estimates. The number is greater than that of American troops who have been killed over 20 years in Iraq and Afghanistan combined. https://t.co/kaD3S9RABG

Disney’s newest animated film, “Turning Red,” has depictions of adolescent rebellion, periods and sexuality. Some parents have objected to the on-screen exploration of those themes, but experts say the topics are appropriate for family discussion. https://t.co/glHBjyRVS3

Spain impounded the Crescent, one of the world’s biggest superyachts, on Wednesday. It is the third such vessel the country has seized since it pledged to hunt for suspected superyachts of Russian oligarchs. https://t.co/MykzQ1HmGD

President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine will ask Congress for aid as Russia bombards his country.
Watch his speech live with analysis from our reporters. https://t.co/1G5f6dFJwN

President Biden plans to announce an additional $800 million in security assistance to Ukraine on Wednesday, White House officials said, only hours after President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine is scheduled to address Congress. https://t.co/a5AuDQLWck

President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine made an urgent and emotional appeal to Congress on Wednesday to come to his country’s aid as it fights off a brutal Russian invasion. "We need you right now," he said. https://t.co/8zKJVziBSp https://t.co/sa82CAqCB2

Olga Smirnova, a Russian ballerina at the Bolshoi, said she was leaving for the Dutch National Ballet. She is one of the most significant cultural figures to leave Russia because of the invasion and said she opposed the war "with all the fibers of my soul."https://t.co/wZ4BqCd9Kj

President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday referred to pro-Western Russians as “scum and traitors” who needed to be removed from society, setting the stage for an ever fiercer crackdown at home and even more aggression abroad. https://t.co/wQlF4z7dFR

The mayor of the Ukrainian city of Melitopol, who was dragged from his office with bag over his head last week by Russian troops, has been freed, according to the head of the Ukrainian presidential administration. https://t.co/N1dyvZfj3Y

In a remarkably direct appeal by a wartime leader to policymakers in Washington, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine made an urgent and emotional appeal to Congress on Wednesday to come to his country’s aid as it fights off a brutal Russian invasion. https://t.co/UfansM4uCs https://t.co/UN8NDvl2ym

More than 75 years after 400 Dutch Jews disappeared in a Nazi roundup that presaged the Holocaust, a historian set out to learn what happened to each and every one of them. She succeeded. https://t.co/GcZRNgEfBf

A Russian-owned superyacht is stranded in Norway because local oil suppliers refuse to refuel the ship.
The yacht is owned by the Russian oligarch Vladimir Strzhalkovsky, a former KGB agent and longtime associate of President Vladimir Putin. https://t.co/E4ObmdHJXp https://t.co/FgN49MvVY0
Breaking News: A powerful 7.3-magnitude earthquake struck near Fukushima in Japan, a region battered by a tsunami 11 years ago. Follow live updates. https://t.co/ACO1uwt8Lo

“To be the leader of the world means to be the leader of peace,” President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said, as members of Congress grew visibly emotional. Lawmakers sat rapt in their seats. Some scribbled notes and many sniffled back tears. https://t.co/rLSGaR3o3S

Breaking News: President Volodomyr Zelensky of Ukraine made an urgent and emotional appeal for help in a speech to Congress and showed searing footage of civilian casualties. https://t.co/SdC81Xstqn https://t.co/GLdMR3TScH
The Ukrainian city of Mykolaiv is being shelled every day. Bodies are piled at the morgue. But residents refuse to succumb. https://t.co/vgIziYXQPm https://t.co/RdEQP9JlJ4

The administration of former Gov. Andrew Cuomo failed to publicly account for the deaths of about 4,100 nursing home residents in New York during the pandemic, according to an audit released on Tuesday by the state comptroller. https://t.co/IQhLcInM2f
